meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a catechism.

meanings.sent2: Her catechismal knowledge of the religious teachings impressed the priest.
meanings.sent3: The catechismal quiz was challenging but fun for the students.

meanings.sent5: The catechismal teachings were ingrained in her mind from a young age.

meanings.definition: In the style or manner of a catechism.
meanings.sent1: The catechismal approach to teaching involved asking questions and providing answers.
meanings.sent2: She adopted a catechismal tone when explaining the rules to the new members.
meanings.sent3: The catechismal way he explained the concept made it easy to understand.
meanings.sent4: Her speech had a catechismal rhythm that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The catechismal structure of the lesson helped the students remember the information.

meanings.definition: Consisting of questions and answers, especially in a religious context.

meanings.sent2: The catechismal format of the class made it interactive and engaging.
meanings.sent3: The catechismal exchange between the priest and the congregation was enlightening.
